column6: Great food, excellent service.  The menu is not the typical "Mediterranean diet" faire and reflects the chef's heritage and the region's flavors.  Try the hummus. Amazing. I had the lamb neck, my wife had the salmon and we shared the eggplant as a side.  All cooked to perfection. Also the wine list is deep in Israeli wines. Highly recommended.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Ten, ten, ten accross the board. Amazing food, fabulous service and great mellow ambiance. We loved every single dish. They are able to elevate lots of dishes from the Jewish diaspora, some Ashkenazi, some Mizrahim, and even Yemeni , just superb. Our waiter was super attentive, helped us picked a wine and provided feedback on questions related to the menu. Very pleasant atmosphere and relax vibe to make any night out amazing. Will definitely keep coming back.

Really enjoyed this meal! Def gets crowded inside so make sure you have a reservation. Go with a a few people, order a bunch of dishes to try. We also got a bottle of red to go with the meal. Everything was delicious, fresh, and different than anything I've had before. I highly recommend this place, def cannot go wrong with any of the menu items. The chicken dish for main entree is a MUST! So delicious. Ambiance is great for a date spot or catch up with a few friends.
No comment
No comment

Not a fan...cute interior, to me, a limited menu. I had the Chicken Shawarma pita which was just ok, a bit too gooey with the aioli and caramelized onions, wasn't enjoying it. I regretted not swinging by a piteria and spending a fraction of the 21 dollar price. It was also a Sunday and perhaps the other menus are a bit more varied. My friend had the Shakshuka, very ordinary.. nothing remotely like the version that we had at Pressed Cafe in the suburbs outside of Boston..we shared the fried olives with homemade labneh and harissa oil which were unique to me and ok. We each had the Harissa Bloody Mary, was ok, and in a rather tall and slender glass..not much of a kick in spice or booze (14 dollars)...Some may love it here, you can judge for yourself.
No comment
No comment

AMAZING spot in the west village. Blown away and expectations were definitely exceeded at Balaboosta. Went with 3 friends and split everything family style. Started out with a bottle of Syrah which was extremely delicious. For starters, we ordered the whipped feta, side of cooked greens, eggplant and one of the specials (not on menu) the eggplant bruschetta. First of all, this pita bread was out of this world good. So warm, fresh and topped in a buttery coating. The rest of the apps also did not disappoint. Everything was flavored so well. For the mains, we ordered the chicken and mushroom pappardelle. Both just wow. Probably some of the best chicken I've ever had. The couscous and sauce that went with it couldn't have been a better combination. We've all had our fair share of some really good Mediterranean food, but balaboosta is definitely high up on that list. Safe to say we will be returning.

Delicious meal! Treated myself to this bougie spot that's difficult to get into and it was worth it! Absolutely loved the branzino and whipped feta & bread. Potatoes, soup dumplings, and cauliflower were pretty good too, but the potatoes were a bit too salty. I also really liked my pomegranate and rosemary mock tail!

This place was wonderful. The spices in the sauce was amazing especially loved the saffron rice, mushroom skewers, the texture of the octopus and flor was wonder. We had the crème brûlée it was certainly the best that I have had. Must have and planning to return before we leave New York

We stopped by Balaboosta based on a Michelin recommended list. However, at best, this was mediocre food with mediocre service. In a city such as NYC with zillions of options, Balaboosta is hardly going to be memorable. We ordered their cauliflower, brick chicken, and soup dumplings. The star of the show was the TWO tiny soup dumplings for the price of $14. Our server checked in on us about 5 minutes before we closed our plates and not once before. Definitely not an experience we expect from a Michelin recommended place. I doubt we will stop by here again.
Couldn't say enough nice things about the staff, food, wine, and atmosphere. Been here a few times, each always exceeds my expectations..... all I can say is "nom nom"

Came here for dinner and sat in their outdoor seating. Their setup was appealing to look at but it was dreadfully quiet. They need to play some music to make it more enthusiastic. Started with the eggplant, bagel, and ceviche. The eggplant and bagel were great but the ceviche was a little fishy for my liking, it would have been good if you're into that. Portions were small so I'd recommend getting multiple. For mains we had the  branzino and the steak, both were enjoyable. Nice spot to mix it up a little and not have the usual. Only wish the ambiance was better

This was my second time at Balaboosta and is was great. Half our party was there early and they were able to seat us immediately. They have an interesting wine list that highlights wines from middle east and the bottles are reasonably priced. Their cocktails are also on point and they infuse some of the liquors themselves. The food is fantastic - everything is very flavourful and the portion sizes are good. It lends itself to sharing, which I prefer anyway because you can try so many more dishes. It's just a really nice, warm, cozy feeling here. Both times we've come for dinner before going out for a late saturday night but it would also be a great place to come for a fabulous meal in its own right. Don't sleep on the tahini creme brûlée .
No comment

Balaboosta is one of the premier Israeli spots in the US, and a must for anyone looking for elevated Middle Eastern cuisine in NYC. Located in an unassuming corner space in the West Village, Balaboosta exudes a buzzy, romantic, downtown vibe that is truly infectious. We stopped in on a busy Saturday evening, and were seated at a fun little table near the back. I started with the Arak Nana, a play on a traditional Israeli arak cocktail, whereas she had a glass of white. I followed that up with a glass of fine Israeli white. Although the vegetarian options were limited, with the restaurant unfortunately running out of a few items, everything we had was incredible. We started with their perfect hummus and their creamy feta dip, drizzled with pomegranate molassses and raisins, which was the highlight of the meal. We followed that up with the delicious roasted cauliflower and roasted potatoes, and ended it with the baklava ice cream, a delicate phyllo pastry stuffed with light, honey and pistachio-flavored ice cream. All in all, Balaboosta made for a perfect West Village evening.
No comment

Balaboosta is giving me COVID RECOVERED vibes! It was a perennial favorite pre 2020 and is bringing the fiyah with its hummus and eggplant offerings. This lamb neck shawarma is all the things. Can't wait til next time!!!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Very mediocre mediterranean food. Brunch menu is very limited. Nothing worth to mention here. Maybe fried olives were interesting but I expected much more. Freshly squeezed orange juice tastes exactly like oj from supermarket would taste like, had to send it back despite server telling it they make it fresh. Overall not worth it at all.
No comment

Food and service was great except they sat a HOMELESS person next to us. I asked the server if that happens on regular basis and he said "you can't deny service". Of course the homeless person walked out without paying. It ruined my whole experience, I was worried about that he would start being violent out of nowhere or anything unexpected. I've never see that happened anywhere!!!! And the manager did ABSOLUTELY NOTHING!
No comment
The food was excellent. Sat at the bar. Great martinis and service from Lea. Cauliflower appetizer was really flavorful. The brick chicken was moist with crispy skin. Perfect. I'll be back.
No comment
Amazing food and better service. Lou was amazing! Best corner. Sit outside and enjoy the people walking, amazing food ans vibe.

I'm going to begin with: maybe this place isn't for everyone. I'm seeing some ignorant posts. We went to Balaboosta because we're familiar with Chef Einat Admony... and we love Israeli food. We also love her Taim falafel. But when we went last night to Balaboosta for the first time, we were sitting next to many "first dates" (an older couple 55+ on my left and 20 somethings on my right). There were a lot of New Yorkers trying to impress each other but thinking this was "just Mediterranean" and we literally heard one of the girls tell her date "we can start with the hummus because that's what you do in 'places like this.' " I wanted to ask her "where else have you eaten like this? Greek? Lebanese?" She just ordered everything on the appetizer list then stared at it when it hit the table.  Chef Einat has created a unique Yemeni Israeli home cooking restaurant. Should you get the hummus? Yes -- delicious. But don't miss the cauliflower with peanut tahini and BAMBA! (I need to try to replicate it at home!). The lamb was extraordinary. And we also had the stuffed cabbage -- which is more like a gigantic dolma than the ashkenazic version (there's no tomato sauce -- it's rice and raisins and savory goodness). The rice was fantastic too... crispy from the pan with dried fruit and pistachios. For cocktails -- we both had Tamar (like an old fashioned with rye, dates and ginger) -- we both loved. Overall: Highly recommended. Cool funky space with an awesome mural of the Chef and her Israeli birth certificate. It gets loud. Go later if you can (we had a reservation at 8pm).

My husband and I enjoyed dinner in balaboosta a few nights ago . The service was great . We had the hummus , branzino , and chicken everything was supper delicious. My husband loved the Arak and grapefruit cocktail and I enjoyed a nice glass of Rose . The desert was a bit disappointing we had fillo Dow with ice cream . But all an all it was a wonderful dinner . We will be back for sure .

Easily made a reservation for three on a Friday night. The Kurkum cocktail, Whipped feta and red snapper (special) were my favorites. Also tried the Lamb neck, cauliflower, Octopus and Halva creme brûlée. Drinks were really excellent, I'd come back just for cocktails. I do think Taboon is better, but Balaboosta has a slightly lower price point. Overall solid.
No comment
No comment

This is the same owners as my favorite falafel place, Taim. We came here for brunch and it was delicious. I loved the ambiance, food and service. I highly recommend the ginger mimosa. It's so refreshing. The chilaquiles were my favorite. The papas bravas and hummus were also good. Make reservations ahead of time.
That whipped feta and pickled raisins!!!!! I would drive back to Chelsea from Ohio for the feta....and everything else frankly. Everything was delicious! Oh, and fried olives! A revelation!!!
No comment
No comment
Definitely highly recommend about this restaurant !!! The chef is super genius with the menu , we enjoyed from every dish !

I don't normally write reviews but everything here was outstanding. Food was delicious and interesting - probably the best branzino I've ever had. Waiter was fantastic and honest. Overall great experience and I'll definitely be back.

So delicious! I come here often. Whether it's for brunch or dinner, you will definitely have a flavorful, enjoyable meal! I love the hummus, beets, cauliflower - the chicken tangine and the patatas bravas. For brunch the shakshuka, omelette and huevos rancheros are great. They have nice outdoor seating right now (during Covid). Great place for a date night, or with friends and family!
No comment

The space is incredible cozy inside -- the perfect date spot with cozy seating, dim lights, and an intimate atmosphere. The beef hummus plate was served with warm and soft pita (be sure to ask for more)! The hummus was very smooth and blended well with the beef. The cucumber salad was a refreshing blend of mint and the tartness of yogurt. We had the lamb neck for our main. The meat was very tender but under seasoned.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Absolutely fantastic food. Everything we tried - food and drinks - was amazing. Don't miss the cauliflower, ceviche, eggplant. The creme brûlée is to die for. Will for sure come back next time we're in the city.
No comment
All I have to say is that the food is amazing. We had all different kinds of dishes and each single one of them was great!

I was so excited to try this place as I'm a huge fan of Taïm, the chef's more casual spot. I'm happy to say it lived up to the hype and beyond! We ordered: the pickles, cauliflower, brussels sprouts, za'atar fettucine, and lamb chops. Every dish was expertly flavored and incredibly fresh. I would have to say the standouts were the cauliflower and the fettucine - both really special. I would recommend this place for a date or catch-up with a friend. I will 100% come back here soon.

came here on a whim and this is hands down one of the best Mediterranean restaurants I've ever been to. the interior is bright and modern and the servers are all so nice. the pita bread is the best I've ever had and they offered seconds as well! their shakshuka and hummus were both delicious and I will definitely be coming back!
No comment
This place has the best Shakshuka in town. Lots of herbs, peppers and good seasoning. The frittata was good and filing as well. Great ambiance, good service and not overpriced.

I was dining by myself and asked for sparkling water and the bartender opens a liter bottle of Pellegrino without letting me know that's the only size they have. $8 of course. They should have the decency to carry small bottles or let you know before opening it. Owner: hope you read this
No comment
No comment

Incredible food, beautiful ambiance and amazing service.   Came for something different while in NYC for a work trip.Myself and  3 of my friends/ co workers came for dinner. Had fried olives, whipped feta for an app. We wanted to almost lick the bowl! Cocktails were strong but delicious. I had the salmon and friends had the mushroom pasta. Both perfect. Our server was Lauren who was only on her 3rd day and was awesome. She kept drinks filled, gave good recommendations and had the best sense of humor. She was professional and witty and made us feel very comfortable. We would follow her and her service to any establishment!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Tasty plates and intimate vibe, warmly decorated and attentively serviced. Prices are high for modest shared plates and the one main we ordered was the most uninspired of the bunch (pappardelle w wild mushrooms alongside a thickened onion sauce). We had the shrimp special which was perfectly crunchy, the hummus tahina (this was solid but nothing to write home about; however the pita it came with was actually a highlight), the octopus was one mouth-wateringly tender tentacle, the cauliflower salad was playfully textured and flavourful and the skirt steak hit a perfectly medium rare sear. Satisfactory experience overall with some imbalances in execution.
No comment

Stopped in for a quick business meeting and was amazed at how amazing the restaurant looked and how laid back the owner and chef is. We tried her white bean hummus and now I'm hooked for life! Highly recommend!

The food here is amazing, but the portions are shockingly small for the cost. Shared the hamachi ceviche and grilled octopus with my friend and left hungry. The hamachi ceviche for $28 consist of 3 bites and the octopus for $32 is a piece of about 5 inches long. Paid $98 for 2 glasses of wine and the 2 dishes and left hungry. Will definitely not return.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

An experience of its own. I've never had better Mediterranean food in my life. Chef Einat does a marvelous job of telling her story, culture, and history through her food. Then comes the service, nothing short of immaculate! If you're in nyc please do yourself the favor and visit.

Excellent brick chicken and skirt steak app. Both were very tasty accentuated with Middle Eastern herbs and flavors. Paired well with a crisp citrus forward Portuguese white. Dined at the bar which seemed a bit more spacious than some of the tables. Slightly too loud especially for a Monday evening.
No comment
No comment

Came here with some friends after hearing wonderful things about this restaurant, and I'm so glad we came in! The restaurant is really cute and charming with large windows and lots of natural light. Some stand out items to me were the hummus basar, cauliflower, chicken and lamb. A great, solid spot!

Birthday dinner at Balaboosta with a friend, loved everything about it! Was seated immediately even though my friend was running late (very atypical for a new york restaurant, and much appreciated). To start we had the pickles and hummus and tahina. Hummus came with fresh and delicious warm pita. We asked for more and we were given another portion with no issues. Small plates we had were the green salad (nice and fresh), Brussels sprouts (when are sprouts not good?!), ceviche  and a seared tuna special. All were delicious! We shared the daurade entree which was perhaps the least exciting dish of the bunch but still very good. I might recommend skipping the entrees and sticking to the amazing smaller plates. If that wasn't enough food, for dessert we got the  halva creme brûlée (unreal) and the tahini cookie dessert (also delicious, lots of cinnamon flavour in the ice cream). To drink we both had the "Yalla" tequila citrus drink and it was so tart and crisp. Overall, would definitely recommend Balaboosta!

Terrible customer service. Made a reservation for 5 via Rezy. Cancelled reservation and the restaurant charged me $125 as a "no show fee." Tried calling to discuss with manager who was incredibly rude and disrespectful.
No comment

We had such a wonderful dinner here to celebrate a special occasion. We were seated at a large table on the lower level. The service was fantastic. Our server accommodated every dietary preference and allergy. We felt pampered. The food was absolutely delicious even when prepared for our special needs (gluten allergy, vegan diet). The hummus is the best I've ever had and I eat a lot of hummus. The fried olives were a real treat. Our main entree (vegan) included the best couscous I've ever eaten. I highly recommend Balaboosta for a special event or any night out. Can't wait to go back.

Love it here! Balaboosta changed their menu a bit but every single thing we ordered we loved. The outdoor dining experience was very pleasant and we even enjoyed buying a few of the pantry items after. The arayes, fried olives, and hummus and pita are musts!

Why every hip, highly reviewed restaurant has to serve delicious, pricey food in miniscule portions is a great mystery. The hummas, salmon, cucumber salad, and short ribs all delicious-but piled together, food for 4 would hardly be enough grub for one hungry guy. One other thing; clever names are fine, but I find it a bit insulting to appropriate the great Yiddish term for a 'super homemaker'-"Balaboosta", to Israeli-inspired fare that has nothing to do with Yiddishe Ashkenazi food that ALWAYS is served in ample portions for a hungry mentsch! If you want an authentic joint with this name, bring back Ratners!
No comment

Our bartender was our server and she was awesome. She made their signature Bloody Mary with whiskey at my request. I got the shawarma which was delicious and we also go patatas braves which were so great. The service was great and it got very busy in there but everyone maintained their gracious demeanor. My only complaint is that it is VERY warm in there but I'm not used to it being 20 degrees outside and 80 degrees inside #californian
Appetizers Are excellent- had the ceviche (beautifully made), hummus (good), eggplant (excellent), cucumber salad (superb). Mains were good but next time I'll spend the entire meal on apps.

My husband and I were in New York on the first night of Passover and their Passover menu was to die for.  We are still talking about the hummus tahina, we love the fried cauliflower.  He had the salmon I had the brisket both dishes were delicious however I like my brisket a little more the red wine sauce on the meat was unbelievable.  We both got dessert as well he got a coconut pudding I got a chocolate pudding and it was just a beautiful ending.  The drinks were very good.  He got a gin cocktail, the gin was za'atar infused the flavor was very unique but delicious.  I will be back!

We had hummus and then deep fried olives that were great.  I had the steak which was a little salty.  I would ask for whatever sauce they put on it on the side next time.  The dessert looked really good but we skipped it because it was really hot inside the restaurant.  We asked several times to adjust the temperature and it didn't ever improve.  Sort of frustrating being that with all of this Coronavirus scare and lack of customers.  Will give it another try and hope they listen when we ask to adjust the temperature.
Just awful food and service.... food was subpar, felt like a dinner ... if you want octopus with chipotle mayo this is your spot!

AMAZING Mediterranean food. Definitely need a reservation, but grabbed some seats at the bar. The bartender was lovely and attentive - she even comped a glass of wine for us for no reason. The hummus was out of this world!
Had a wonderful meal with Nickolay at the bar on Thursday evening. Hummus tahini is not to be missed. Beautifully presented fish, delicious dessert. Looking forward to a return visit.
Delicious brunch. Hummus is a must try, as is the shakshuka. Tomato sauce in the shakshuka tasted very fresh and there wasn't too much salt in the dish.

The BEST Mediterranean food I've had so far in NYC! We ordered the hummus, eggplant (a MUST - so delicious), cauliflower, green salad and the sea bream and every single dish was beautifully presented and tasted incredible. Additionally, the service was exceptional. We were seated right away, the hostess took our coats for us, and our server was extremely attentive - really was some of the most impressive service I've received at a restaurant in NYC recently. The food is delicious, the vibe is friendly, and the service is great - WELL worth your money. I can't recommend Balaboosta enough!
Had pickles, whipped feta, hummus basar, octopus, and lamb - too much food for two people, but every dish was delicious! Especially the octopus - Super tender. A great option for a nice dinner.

Not great food (and the word in Yiddish is balebuste) Taste of food average. I ate better hummus. The brick chicken nothing special and the fish dish was very very small and poor and not great. Not coming back and I don't recommend it! You want better "israeli" food I super recommend "Lamalo" in the city, great food, super different and tasty and great service for similar budget.
Had brick chicken, green salad, and kasata - OMG everything was so good!
I miss the old location and menu, but am just so glad they are open again! My all time favorite brunch spot. Best. Hummus. Ever.

Simply amazing.  All the dishes were good but the short ribs and the halva creme brûlée were to die for.   The short ribs melt in your mouth and the sauce is nutty and a perfect touch with the sweet potatoes.   The creme brûlée was not too rich and just made a delectable combo with the halva.  Yum!!
Really good food and drinks! Great Sunday morning brunch vibe as well, and had not that much of a wait. I'm coming back!

Disappointing bordering on infuriating. The five of us arrived for our 5:30 pm reservation, excited to enjoy the good food and great vibe we have enjoyed at Balaboosta since it opened on Elizabeth Street. The reservation was for "downstairs" think: first floor. We were led to a veritable dungeon - a claustrophobic basement with nondescript decor, and a few ugly, bare tables. ALL the tables on the first floor were empty, but when we asked to be seated there, we were told they were all booked and the restaurant doesn't seat parties of more than four on the first floor. Ridiculous! We suffered through excruciatingly slow service, with one inattentive waiter, and unremarkable dishes that just were not up to the standards of our previous visits. When we resurfaced on the first floor two hours later, there were several tables empty, large enough to fit our party. We will not be going back any time soon!

I'm not sure if it was an off night and they had the B team cooking (Chef Einat certainly was not), or things are generally meh, but the food was quite mediocre.  The Hummus with Basar (meat) was good, but nothing memorable - there are plenty of Hummus places in the city with equal or better Hummus at half the price.  The short ribs were disappointing - while tender, the meat actually had no flavor unto itself and the outside was burnt.  The pasta was made with too much flour and consequently had a poor texture.  Also flavor was lacking.   Chef definitely put thought into the menu, but the execution (at least that night) was poor.  Unfortunately, we were disappointed.  I will say, however, the staff was very welcoming and attentive.    (One thing that did bug me is that a restaurant with a $30 entree price point that attempts some menu sophistication should try to have some dress standards - shorts and baseball caps for dinner just do not cut it in my book.  )
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Food, atmosphere, and service was amazing. I got the carne asada tacos and the Mexican street corn.

First time at a cozy Mexican restaurant in the Soho area. The outside does look fancy and inviting. We came here for a birthday party of 36 people. My friend booked for a Family Style Pre-Fixed Menu for $65 (alcohol not included). It is difficult to get a restaurant to secure a large party of this scale. We had to be seated at different tables (3 separate ones). Food wise everything was fantastic. What we had was the Shrimp Tacos, Tamales, Pinto Beans Guacamole, Seared Salmon, Churro Ice Cream, and the Chimichurri Steak. My deductions had to go with the portions offered to us. It is difficult to serve a party of 36 people but what I would've liked was to enjoy more heartier portions of the food. The other 2 tables was offered a nice amount of food but our table, at most each diner only had 2 bites to sample from each dish. And for the price we paid, it was hefty to pay over $100 for a small amount of food. It was my friend's birthday so I told myself the contributions was going towards his special day. But as a diner, I was expecting more. Maybe if I came on a small intimate dinner with a few diners, perhaps the portions would be better. Just the pre-fixed menu experience wasn't doing it for me.
Great ambiance, friendly staff and AMAZING food! We got the carne asada tacos, the shrimp tacos, and the chicken quesadillas and they were all. Amazing. Highly recommend!
This place has amazing queso. And amazing service. Also drinks are strong! Highly recommend, especially for larger groups/parties

Our first time coming. Came specifically to celebrate my fiancé's birthday and it was so good. The special was the empanadas - they tasted great. The quesadillas had the perfect amount of salsa and the tacos were so good. They were slightly spicy for me but still great. Service here was so good as well - the waiter let us know how great the house tequila actually is and did not try to upsell us.

Honestly this place was super great!!! I got the tempura battered fish tacos and I loved them they were amazingggg, I even wished they had more fish in them to get some more goodness! The spicy marg was also fantastic, definitely the best spicy marg I've had recently and I have to say this might be my new favorite spot to get them! The drink wasn't spicy in an overwhelming way where your mouth catches on fire but spicy in a subdued smoky, perfectly blended kinda way and the strength of the drink was perfect!!! You could tell it was strong but it didn't taste like you were just drinking straight up liquor, having a much better perfectly balanced taste between the marg flavor and the alcohol instead, and it went down super smooth!! When I tell you this drink was mixed so well I mean it, I was super impressed, and I got mine with the mezcal preparation (they asked if I wanted tequila or mezcal) and it was sooo good!!! I highly recommend mezcal in the margs for a smokier taste. Overall highly recommend this place!! Food was great, drinks were amazing and the decor/ambiance/servers were all fantastic!!! 10/10.
No comment
No comment

This place is so pretty! Everything we ate was yummy, and the man who helped us was sooo nice and accommodating! He let me charge my phone lol. The drinks were amazing. Kind of a small menu, but reasonable prices and tasted great.
No comment
No comment
No comment
The food was unreal. I still regret not being able to finish my plate of birria tacos. Need to go back asap!
Great atmosphere! Loved the drinks, loved the tacos and quesadilla. Easy to grab a quick bite or a big meal- or even just drinks the mojito was perfect! Great vibez all around.
No comment

Had dinner at casa bocado with a group of 5 and we had a great time. The hostess and servers were friendly and accommodating. Gluten free (gf) options were noted clearly on the menu and everyone loved their food. Really liked the spicy marg

As a resident of San Diego, CA I confirm the guacamole here is as real and delicious as it gets. You will also be tempted to hide a few chips in a baggie for later. The food was authentic, fresh and full of flavor. The atmosphere was colorful and upbeat with spacious nice outdoor seating. The management and staff were incredibly friendly and attentive. Never waited to order a drink and also never felt rushed to leave as my friend and I were catching up after not seeing each other for a year.  Perfect spot for any occasion.

Came here for drinks and an appetizer, and I was impressed! The interior is gorgeous and immersive, and lively Spanish music makes for a very fun vibe. I had the strawberry margarita and the regular margarita. The strawberry was pretty sweet but nothing over the top and both margs were strong for sure. We just got chips and guac to eat, and the guac was delicious, even adding pomegranate seeds which was a unique touch and added a pop of flavor and texture. Service was friendly and kind, and I'd love to come back to try an entree!
No comment
No comment

column3: Budd Lake, Mount Olive Township, NJ
column6: We chose to go to this restaurant on a whim to celebrate my boyfriends birthday. The drinks were awesome, the queso fundido was TO DIE FOR, and the churro sundae was amazing. The best part was that the servers were kind enough to read my reservation note and put a candle on the dessert for him and even gave us free birthday shots. Amazing hospitality! My only comment is that the elote/street corn was relatively tasteless, but everything else was amazing.
Right around the corner from my husbands office. Came to try and it was not great. The steak was okay. But everything else we got was disappointing.
No comment

I am impressed, Casa Bocado was simply remarkable. They are more affordable than the competition. Everything tasted fresh and was very good! Service is wonderful and team very friendly. Sometimes things are just done right.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This establishment scammed me.  I ordered four tacos over the phone TO GO. When I got there the bill was 60 dollars.  I asked how much each taco cost because I only ordered four single tacos. The waiter told me I had ordered four tacos, and that's why the total was 60.  He then TOOK my card out of my hand, and put it into the chip reader, saying "we are going to pay for this now". When I opened the tacos, it was three PER container. I went back letting them know I asked four single tacos not knowing three came with each order, they responded they couldn't do anything about it, that I paid already.  I feel disrespected and taken advantage of, and violated that a waiter would so boldly take a card out of my hand. I would not recommend this place AT ALL.

Amazing tacos and guacamole!! The staff is very nice and attentive, and the tacos are delicious. Good portions for the price point, I definitely feel like I got my money's worth. The addition of pomegranate seeds on the guacamole was incredible, it's a must try if you go here.
No comment

Drinks are good for $16 each  If you're there around 11pm the waiters try to rudely throw you out of the back pretty quickly with harsh, blinding lights and your check (without asking for it) when they can easily communicate they want you to leave when you are half way done with your drink. When I asked that they re-adjust the lights, the waiter told me to move if I didn't like it. I guess that's fair if you're spending money on a night out. We probably would have ordered a couple more drinks and left a generous tip but left and went to another bar where we paid $12 per drink. The gentleman at the front desk was super, super nice.
Spicy margarita, check. Amazing guacamole, check. We will be here every week. PS the queso is delicious. Ask for Cesar

WHAT is this item! Instead of having my paper check given to me like a normal restaurant I got this ODD item. Honeslty I was pretty disappointed with this place to start when we told them it was my girlfriends birthday and they said they would bring her something and never did. She deserves to be celebrated! Sad :( place was fine though - not dying to come back
No comment
No comment

I visited Casa Bocado with some girlfriends recently. We were really happy with the selection cocktails. The music was great + the energy was perfect - sexy yet subtle. And, we were thrilled with the attention we received from the staff.  The entire staff took safety precautions. Returning soon!

It was my first time here. I got al pastor tacos and a sangria. The tacos were not hot but warm but they taste really good. They were very well seasoned just wish they were hotter. The sangria was good but over priced. I paid more money for the small sangria then my food.

I went to casa for my friends birthday and the food was AMAZING. We ordered guacamole and chips to begin with and it was probably the best guacamole I've ever had.The fish tacos changed my life, and we also ordered a tuna dish (forgot what it was called) but I would ask the servers (it came with seaweed salad) and it was delectable. The service and everything there was also incredible and I am definitely going back. Such a lovely experience.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Honestly, was more than impressed. The vibe was very exciting but also relaxing. Made me want to go out and dance after because the people I met, David, Raquel and Kelvin made me feel at home and like it was warm outside in this cold weather. Should be more happening here because it is actually legit. Been in the city for 8 years and when you meet good people you don't forget. I never leave reviews but damn, this was uplifting for everyone around. You can feel the energy because the FAM actually cares and are super chill and I think I fell in love with everyone. Yikes!

Came here with two friends for Saturday brunch and enjoyed every second of our visit. From the finely crafted refreshing cocktails at the bar to the warm greeting and hospitality from Cesar and staff. We tried the guacamole with pomegranate seeds, the grilled fish tacos with fresh & flaky mahi-mahi, the queso fundido with its different types of cheese which blended perfectly, and the salsa sampler with their spices offering a variety of heat levels. Thanks to Cesar for all these amazing recommendations and making our visit a special one. Will surely be returning and recommending this restaurant

My wife and I came here after my company Christmas party and we were staying in the city for the night since we had a wedding the following day so we decided to check this spot out. Always down to try and newThe spicy margarita was straight FIRE so A+ for that BUT, let's talk about the carne asada tacos...forget Dos Caminos...YOU NEED to try them NOW!!! Add a little hot sauce and it just makes it even better, flavoring was on point (I've had so many bland ass tacos in NYC it's incredible...these are AMAZING) definitely coming back for some more margaritas!
No comment
No comment

We went for my friends birthday with 12 people and ended up paying $1,500 for some bum ass food. No cap. We ordered 24 shots of tequila and they watered them down. On baby. Then they were charging $65 for 1 tequila pitcher. And the food wasn't hitting. And they forced us to have the set menu at $65 I wasn't ever hungry. Smh.  Damn shame

Second time here, pleasantly surprised both times . The bartender turned me onto Jalapeño mango margaritas... life changing. Reasonably priced food, tacos were flavorful and the tuna ceviche was delicious.

Casa Bocado was a delicious surprise. We ordered the Carne Asada Tampiqueña the steak was cooked perfectly. The tempura battered fish tacos are a must! The staff is super friendly and accommodating a friend of mine is paleo they accommodated her needs. I will definitely be back soon to enjoy the yummy food and drinks!!!
Very good food and friendly staff! Gave us a round of shots on the house to get our Santacon started!
Came here for a Bday brunch, 5 stars because everything was perfect. I recommend The burger, very filling and delicious. Thanks James and the Bocado staff. We'll be back.

Love coming here for some tacos and tequila. They have a giant selection of tequila so there is always something new to try and the food is bomb. The upstairs is a restaurant and there's outdoor seating as well, and then when you're 3-4 shots of tequila deep you can go downstairs for some salsa dancing. How can you beat that?

I live in the neighborhood and happened to stop in a for a drink. The staff was so friendly that I decided to stay and have dinner here with my friend. We had the queso fundido, guac, steak tacos. Food was delicious but the highlight was definitely the spicy mango margaritas - they have a tamarind salt rim (my favorite!) and use ancho reyes instead of triple sec. Highly recommended! Also Cesar was our server, ask for him if you come here.

Casa Bocado is my new go to spot in the city for tequila and authentic mexican food. their guacamole is still the best i've ever had. great place to go for food and drinks. also they are pet friendly, which was huge for me.

Beautiful place, great date spot that I've been coming to for a few months. Love the food, I had the skirt steak tampiquena. The queso fundidio was to die for as well. Go for the mezcal drinks if you want something unique.
Wonderful staff. Love the decor. I didn't drink but my friend raved about the margarita. Food was yummy. This is now a go to after work spot.

Casa Bocado is a great place for Brunch. The food is amazing and the personal is great and very friendly, I recommend this place to anybody looking for mexican food. Server who was our server was amazing, he helped us with the menu and advised on which meal to get according to our preferences. We had an amazing time and we will definitely come back!
No comment

Updated review! I was sent an email apologizing about our waitress from the last time I was here. They invited me back and the food and service was amazing. The guacamole is next level and so are the tacos!
No comment

I had the fish tacos, Mexican corn, guacamole and mango margarita. Everything was ahhhmaaazing! The guacamole had pomegranate in it, the margarita had a kick of spice with jalapeño. The chef really loved my food and I appreciated it. Who knew you could find such good Mexican food in Little Italy. I highly recommend. The wait staff and hostess were both friendly. The management checked on us multiple times, even with a full restaurant. I can't say enough great things about this place.
No comment
No comment

Extremely deserving of my first Yelp review. I can't say enough great things about this restaurant! The food, drinks, and service were spectacular. The space itself is beautiful and very clean as well. We tried the guacamole, street corn, chicken tacos and fish tacos. The spicy mango margarita was incredible. I will be back!!!

This is one of my go-to spots for a super chill ambiance accompanied by great service and lots of tequila! Decor is what I would describe as sexy naturesque style with hints of colorful Mexican inspired art throughout the space. The servers are very attentive and friendly. Always willing to accommodate any request to the best of their ability. The guacamole is excellent with added pomegranate seeds for a bit of sweetness and some texture. I don't eat beef, pork or poultry, but the fish and vegan friendly options I have tried were all delicious and always look amazing on the plate, very instagram friendly! Overall a great lively ambiance if you're in the mood for some latin music and Mexican inspired dishes!

Definitely come on Saturdays when the cute brunette bartender with a nose ring is working. She is super fast and on point with drinks! The food is also really great- I recommend the steak or chicken dinner.

I want to start off by saying such an amazing experience, I love the environment I had such a good time and the food was Great. I will definitely recommend this to my fellow friends I highly recommend this restaurant.
No comment

Great Authentic Mexican food with a fun atmosphere. Clean establishment with an attentive service staff. The Carne Asada tacos were great along with the Mexican street corn. Fresh guacamole and homemade chips were perfection. Definitely a must visit.
Came here for brunch. Their bottomless sangria was dangerous!! Came here with the girls and it was so much fun! Food was great and music was so fun. Definitely doing another girls brunch here soon!!
No comment
Loved this place! We had a great night and loved the food. The host was friendly and the service was good as well. Will defintiely be back!

I'm Latina and I'm telling you these are some of the best tacos I've ever had! Great ambiance, fantastic service and an overall good time! Highly recommend the watermelon margarita and you have to get the dessert! HOME. MADE. CHURROS.

Go somewhere else. We had an 8pm reservation on a Saturday night for 4 people. The music is insanely loud - a plus if you're looking for a rowdy bar, but a negative if you're looking to hear the person a foot away from you. The vibe and scene is just off. Since the restaurant was half full, we asked to move to another table further away from the speakers. They said no, they were full for the night (as we looked at a handful of empty tables) and said there was nothing they could do about the music. We decided to leave but the waitress handed us a bill for $8 for water we never touched. She was shady and deceitful and told us "it is what it is". The entire experience was horrible, and there are so many other great spots nearby.
Great spot. Thank you Cesar for great service! Will be back soon! Loved everything, very nice spot.

Went there for a birthday dinner party of 8 and had an excellent experience.  Fun, lively atmosphere and music, perfect for a birthday.  Attentive, friendly and personable service.  The guacamole with pomegranate seeds is unique and delicious and was a huge hit along with the queso fundido.  Everyone ordered either a regular or watermelon margarita which were made just right - not too sweet.  We ordered a variety of tacos which were all great.  The restaurant staff surprised us with complimentary birthday churros and tequila which made the evening even more special.  Highly recommend this restaurant for a birthday or any occasion for which you want to have a fun evening!

Can not get their act together. 20 minutes after arriving for our reservation, still don't have a table. Perhaps they forgot the definition of "reservation." Their pliant relationship with time leaves much to be desired. Also lacking: a decibel level that won't leave your ears ringing long after you've forgotten about the amateur production of "Mexican restaurant" these high school performers are attempting to mask with music loud enough to drown out their inadequacy.

Came for a few bites with the fam and I was amazed about the delicious food, ambiance and specially the very attentive staff. Cesar Garcia was very helpful and point out to the best dishes. One of the best experience I ever had, everyone should definitely try it.

The noise level is unbearable. Went with a few friends for dinner and we were yelling at each other across the table. The bar is lively so recommend just stopping for a drink, but don't recommend if you want to have a conversation over dinner. It's also very overpriced for what it is, and the waitress was shady about hidden costs not on the menu. Won't be back.
Awesome spot in Bowery/LES!! Great food, great vibe! The carne tacos were incredible. Highly recommend.

Love everything about this place!  The atmosphere, the staff, and especially the food.  We started with the chicken taquitos which were extremely tasty and flavorful.  Throw in a perfect Spicy Margarita and I was feeling it.  Next, I ordered the tempura fish tacos while my friend tried the pork tacos.  Both were amazing, especially the fish tacos which were some of the best I've ever had.  And I can't say enough about the service:  Our server was knowledgeable, attentive, and very friendly.  The place itself had a warm, cozy vibe that felt authentic.  Overall, a wonderful experience!
Had such an amazing experience at Casa Bocado! Their manager Cesar and his staff were so helpful and the food/cocktails were delicious! Can't wait to go back!
Came here for brunch. Their bottomless sangria was dangerous!! Came here with the girls and it was so much fun! Food was great and music was so fun. Definitely doing another girls brunch here soon!
My friends and I met at this amazing restaurant - they have a great cocktail selection and a superb food menu. Would recommend them 100%.

This is one of my favorite go to spots in NYC for dinner. The staff is super friendly and attentive & food is beyond my expectations. Also, the guacamole is to die for ! I definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for authentic Mexican cuisine !
Awesome music and vibes. The food was really good too! Highly recommend the carne asada tacos, guacamole, and queso fundido. Perfect for a dinner with friends or a date. Definitely coming back!!
Such a great food, fast service, and best quality. I'd recommend the margarita, is the best I've tried so far.

The best new Mexican restaurant in NYC. Casa Bocado food is second to none with a wide variety of different dishes & a excellent selection of cocktails as well. I have been to dinner, brunch and even had a event hosted. The service is always amazing from a very courteous staff. I highly recommend visiting this amazing restaurant.

Great spot for brunching, all of the bottomless cocktails are of very high quality. The Carne Asada and Eggs + Avocado Toast (with Smoked Salmon) were great. Venue has great decorations and excellent themed music.

The food and customer service was beyond what I could've asked for. The woman who helped us throughout the night was so kind and went out of her way. I've never had such great service on such a busy night. The food was delicious and not one flaw that I could find about anything with this place. Recommend for sure but always make a reservation since they are busy and it is the city.

amazing place!! we celebrated my birthday on Thursday and  they had this awesome band playing. the singer had a great voice and created a really awesome ambiance. we started with the guac, then carne asada and grilled fish tacos and shared the red snapper. all were delicious and the cocktails were fantastic - especially the sangria and spicy mango margarita. we will definitely be back! ps they have an awesome churro sundae in a skull cup - very cool

I cannot say enough about how amazing this restaurant is--from the atmosphere to the quality of the food, everything has been near perfect each time I visit.  The staff is friendly, accommodating, and willing to go above and beyond to make sure their guests are happy. I will be visiting Casa Bocado again (and again, and again)...

My business school's NY alumni group recently held a happy hour for about 50 people at Casa Bocado.  The Casa Bocado team did a wonderful job working with us to ensure we had a wonderful experience -- both in the planning and in a super smooth execution of the event. The atmosphere was festive, the food was amazing, and everyone who came had a fantastic time. They made it as easy as possible and the event was massive success.  Many thanks Casa Bocado!!

We stopped here for happy hour one day and really enjoyed sitting outside drinking their margaritas (tried watermelon and mango -- both great!). Service was nice, food was good (guacamole especially). Would recommend for some good Bowery people-watching!

My friend took me to this new place the other day that recently opened on Broome st. Food was amazing and the drinks were unique and refreshing. The Carnita tacos were some of the best I've ever had. Also tried the lobster ceviche which was fantastic. For drinks my friend had a pitcher of the watermelon margarita which was great and I had the tropical tequila which was refreshing and crisp. Definitely will be my go to spot when I'm in the area.
Best tacos, best service, and best guac. My sister came to visit recently and we ate there 3 times through the weekend. Highly recommend.

We had an amazing meal at Casa Bocado! The queso is amazing and the tacos tasted as good as they looked. Great vibe and ambiance as well. The staff was fun, friendly and very accommodating. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Can't wait to go back!

Came in after work with my co workers. Really impressed !! The decor was great the food was great and the drinkss were amazzzinnnggg. I'm a very picky eater however this is one of the best places for tacos! Will be recommending to other people and will be back for sure.

The hype is real! This place is hard to get into, but it's worth the wait. Laser Wolf is an Israeli skewer and kebab house and all the dishes are made to share. There's about 3 skewers in each order and they are massive. I would recommend 1-2 skewer dishes per person. The meals come out with about 10 different sides (Salatim), fresh hummus, and pita. We ordered the lamb kofta, lamb & beef koobedih, brisket, and salmon. They were all delicious, but I think the lamb and brisket were my two personal favorites. The Date-Harissa Wings and the French Fries were out of this world. The skewers and the salatim with the hummus and pita were way more than enough food, but I am glad we tried the Al la cart appetizers. They bring out a soft serve ice cream dipped in a tahini sesame sauce that is out of this world. Don't worry about not finishing all your sides and your meal, they give plenty of to go containers for you to take home the generous portions of food. On a nice day you will get a beautiful skyline view of Manhattan and in the summer the rooftop retracts. The roof and view is a vibe for sure. Our service was impeccable. Brian was so kind to us and explained all of the dishes in detail. Be sure to ask about how the French fries are made! Our waiter was also extremely attentive and super personable. I will definitely be back (if I can get in again!)

This place lives up to the hype and then some! We got the lamb and then instead of another meat dish did the sides for an extra person for $28 which was great. I'm not a huge meat eater so didn't need another meat dish but the lamb was excellent, it tasted really lamb-y in a great way. It was also a very nice sized portion. Our server Josh was excellent, super nice and fun, also gave great recommendations on the food and on the wine we got which was loved. The view was also incredible, we came in the winter so there is a plastic type thing making it stay warm but still able to see the view and that was just perfect. Dessert I was worried would just be an after thought but it had amazing unique flavors and was excellent. Everything thing here was just 10/10
No comment

Pretty amazing restaurant...beautiful hotel walk up with another sister restaurant to walk in to (Kfar), and then check in at elevator to go up to Laser Wolf. Great atmostphere, location, view, service (with Brian). Girl folding towels a bit of a puss, with no smile and didn't seem to be happy....but I digress. Brian was just the right amount of smiles, service, interuption. The food of course was crazy unbelievable. 9-10 Israeli "sides" with the best pita bread EVER. We chose the steak (OMG spices are on par), and Brisket Kabob (delish typical kabob in my opinion)....the cocktails were very tasty and the Israeli Rose was delish. I think the soft serve was a perfect end to my birthday celebration (as much as others thought not), I loved the simplicity and instant gratification instead of perusing the menu for desserts. I can assure you this will be a great experience, and a place to remember forever. We enjoyed it tremendously, and it will not disappoint. Kudos Laser Wolf!!

We came to this rooftop restaurant after my birthday dinner, and the views and interior decor at night are truly stunning. We were seated at the bar and were served without much of a wait. My girlfriend enjoyed the Get Shishlik'd because it had Guava in it. The Crime of Passion with Plantation and Spiced Rum wasn't as strong as it may seem, probably due to the passion sweet which gave it a semi-sweetness. Next time I will come and try their dinner options, which are unique and admittedly pricey.

Super tasty food and incredible view! Not sure it lived up to the crazy hype, but was still really good. Kind of expensive for what you get. I would go with a small group.
No comment

First, service was great! The waiter made recommendations, explained everything, and gave recommendations on after dinner drink spots. Second, the views were spectacular! I just wished it wasn't so cold because the clear covering they use has a bit of a glare which definitely takes away from it. Last the food.....flavorful, tasty, sufficient portions!! Best food we had while in NY! Drinks were good too, I had the sour patch kidz and crime of passion (super sweet).

The salatim were unique and memorable. They made the meal. And the bread, perfect. Staff were friendly and helpful. Loved the cocktails and dessert. The view of NYC was the icing on the cake.
No comment
No comment

The Salatim (vegetable appetizers), all 11 of them ranged from good to excellent, particularly the babaganoush, beans and the hummus and pita. The al carte section of the menu was good too was goodincludnig the whole trout and amba-spiced eggplant.  For dessert there was a brown sugar soft serve with sesame and cherry crunchies which was very tasty.  Service was good and the views of Manhattan were outstanding.

After months of waiting, finally was able to grab a reservation of 4 at 11:30 pm on a Friday night. The view was amazing and the ambiance was very nice. We got 4 different entrees, the wings and the big salatim. The salatim dishes were all very tasty and the pita bread was so fluffy. The mains were all a bit too salty and dry for my taste. Would recommend this place for the salatim!
No comment

The only reason I didn't give Laser Wolf  5 stars was because of the service. All the food was excellent and the restaurant has killer vibes. The Dry Aged T-Bone was one of the best steaks I have had in a long time and although not pictured, the Date Harissa Wings w/Tehina Ranch were a surprise stunner. Don't skip on the Amba-Spiced Eggplant dispute the steep price tag...it was a nice balance to the steak. I will say, wish the wine menu was a bit more exciting as well as the desserts, but at the end of the meal, all I could think about was the steak so it didn't matter much. Will be going back ASAP.

Get the steak skewers! They were the highlight, along with the soft serve coated with tahini and brown sugar. The ribs were okay, but felt like a bad version of kbbq with their choice of sauce on them. The starters they were provided were delicious and the pita were warm and filling. Great experience and great views! Highly recommend, and make sure to get a reservation. Heard wait times were 2 hours even at 5pm, which is when we came.
No comment

No comment

Took my partner here for his bday and we were treated so extremely well by staff. It was such a pleasure from the views and ambience and of course the main event, the food! We had the lamb and the chicken, just amazing. Can't wait to bring some other friends and family back for more wonderful drinks and food!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Food was okay and honestly easy to find similar quality at better price points. Service was very inattentive and may I say lazy... the waiter forgot what we ordered and food arrived terrible late after I asked to cancel it due to delay. The tables are very small for two people and the ambiance is lackluster. Save your coins unless you're a group of five that care less about food and more about company. Overhyped. $$$
Best Israeli food on this side of the world. Took me right back to Tel Aviv. Truly a must try... and the views were spectacular.
No comment
No comment

The ambiance of Laser Wolf was amazing! It's located on a rooftop that has a beautiful view of the Manhattan skyline. The food was phenomenal and the best part were the side dishes that come with the entrees! Will definitely be back!

Great views and food! Friendly and fast service! Definitely requires a reservation. Great place to come with a group of friends and catch the sunset on the rooftop! Steak kebab and the trout was tasty! Entrees are a bit pricey for the portions. But overall a good experience.

This place has a lot going for it and is definitely a popular spot that is on a lot of folks list. The menu structure is almost as interesting as the view (unless of course you go on cloudy day as we did). On average without cocktails your meal will be about $55-58 per person and that is inclusive of a protein/veggie main with a side of basmati rice, appetizer and dessert. Really the only thing you pick is your main and the appetizer is the salatim. Fresh hot pita at your beck and call with all the dips and veggie toppings your heart could desire. More than enough for two people, we couldn't even finish it all and saw other folks taking a box to go. This was the saving grace of the meal because the main proteins were smaller than I imagined. We got the beef/lamb kebab and short rib. Each the size of 1 skewer. I honestly might have been mad about it if I wasn't so full off of the salatim by the time we got it and I didn't have dessert in the back of my mind for the near future. My angst quickly faded though after tasting the meats. They were cooked perfectly and super succulent, very satisfying. We ended our meal with a cool and creamy treat- a brown sugar soft serve that came with a tahini hard shell on top that was fabulous. Reminiscent of a peanut butter dip I would get as a child. A great date spot to go to especially if you're trying to impress.
No comment

I had a wonderful time at Laser Wolf this past week celebrating a friend's birthday. It was understandably pretty tough to get a reservation, so we had to settle for a Sunday night, but worth it. The space itself is huge and airy, with unbeatable views of the NYC skyline. It was a bit chilly the evening we went, but I imagine sitting outside in the summer would be incredible. Our servers were great, super attentive and explained how their menu worked. Menu is pre-fixe, each diner gets a protein that is grilled with unlimited dips and sides. We were with a large group so we had an array of proteins, and all were grilled to perfection. I personally had the chicken and loved it. I don't usually like baba ganoush, but this one was delicious, and the hummus was one of my favorites. They top off the dinner with a brown sugar ice cream for everyone, which was such a treat and just enough after a big meal. I felt the price point for this was right on target- it definitely seemed reasonable for the amount and quality of the food. Snag a reservation if you can!
No comment

Beautiful views and delicious food. If you can snag a reservation, you should definitely go. The pita was perfectly soft and fluffy. The salatim was superb and so good that we ended up getting refills of many (refills were free which was a nice bonus). The grilled eggplant was bursting with flavor and the meats grilled to perfection. My girlfriends and I were stuffed by the end of our meal but in the best way.
No comment
No comment

I was expecting this place to be overrated, but I found it worth the hype. The food was absolutely delicious and while the pre-fixe is on the more expensive side for a regular dinner, you get a lot of food (ny boyfriend and I couldn't finish the Salatim, which also comes with free refills should you want them). The service was excellent as well. Would love to come back in the summer months to better enjoy the view.

Great location. Awesome view of NYC. I would definitely try to come with a group. You can order pre fixed menu which comes with the platter of Salatim and then you order your main entree. We had the whole trout which was done to perfection with crispy skin. I had the lamb and beef koobideh but I wished I ordered the BBQ short rib like the next table . The koobideh was good but needed more spices. The French Fries are a must. They top it off with a Brown Sugar Soft Serve.
No comment

Laser wolf is great!! The ambiance is amazing - great views of NYC and open kitchen. The starting veggie platter is delicious, lots of great pickled veggies and spreads. We got the chicken, brisket and BBQ short ribs for our meat. The chicken and BBQ were my favorite. They also bring out dessert at the end which is ice cream with tahini sauce and cherries. Great palate cleanser! Overall would highly recommend for great vibes and food.

AmaIng vibe and setting. Wonderful ambience and views. Good service. But food itself not worth the price. Chicken wings, bbq short ribs were tasty. Hummus average. Other Mediterranean places are better. Fun to go once though for the hummus / sides platter! All very fresh and unique

This dinner hit the spot.  Laser Wolf is a fabulous spot for a group dinner in part because of all of the shareable starters and the similarly priced main options (I went for the eggplant and the portion was huge) - the ice cream at the end was the perfect ending to a fabulous dinner (even if it was a 10:45pm dinner since that was the only time we could score on a Saturday)
No comment

We are group of 3 seated at one of the best views on Manhattan. Great service, you don't feel rushed despite the place being full.  Come with your stomach empty as you'll be so full with delicious, generous servings. Definitely will wanna come again. Book fast. We literally waited 21 days for this reservation.
It's a good place to go with fam or friends. Has a nice view to the cityyyy, the vibes and the servers it's good.
No comment
No comment

Amazing food and view. Roque was our server and he was very friendly and helpful. The salatim are so good. My favorites were the beans with olives and the pineapple with celery. Unexpected but delicious combo. Hummus and baba ganoush were also great. For skewers we tried the short rib and eggplant and enjoyed both but let me tell you - the short rib is a must-order! It comes with these intensely caramelized pearl onions and amba sauce that pair perfectly with the short rib. We were lucky to get in on a rainy weeknight without a reservation.
Great view of manhattan. Great vibes and drinks. REALLY good hummus. Just a little too pricey.
No comment
Considering the location and view, the price was GREAT! Steak was the standout - it was magical. Highly recommend! Also ordered the Kofta - still amazing.
Such a beautiful experience! The food was amazing and loved trying all the different salads! Our waitress was also so kind and all the staff were friendly and informative.
Rooftop bar with a view at the Hoxton. I was here for an awesome wedding. The food and view were great. The drinks were all yummy. Food was flavorful and savory. Everything was delicious.
No comment

Vegans and vegetarians, get ready for an experience. Start with the Salatim with pita and sample a variety of appetizers. The variety was incredible and tastes and textures were delicious. The ala carte fries and tahini ketchup were a surprise that could become an addiction. Schwarma seasoned cauliflower was very good, charred on the grill. The Amba Spiced Eggplant was incredible- texture and flavor- and would be my choice at every visit. We went on a cooler night and curtains were down and the room was fairly noisy.

All the food was delicious and the views were amazing!It's an interesting menu concept. I did feel they fill you up on the salatim/ pita and then give small portions of meat. The drinks were overpriced and I didn't love my mezcal one- very tart. Service could improve...our server forgot our order and came back 10 minutes later to ask again, I was annoyed that he also took my drink away before I was done- ask next time if it's not empty.
